title: Confusing errors from type (mis-)inference

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in

Given the following code: ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=72ec0bfb4ebb032851fc08d57654e699))

```rust
fn main() {
    let mut b = vec![];
    let s = "XYZ".to_string();
    let a: Vec<_> = b.iter().map(|s| f(s)).collect();
    b.push(s);
}

fn f(s: &str) -> String {
    s.to_string()
}
```

The current output is:

```
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[[E0277]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0277): the size for values of type `str` cannot be known at compilation time
 --> src/lib.rs:4:30
  |
4 |     let a: Vec<_> = b.iter().map(|s| f(s)).collect();
  |                              ^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `str`
  = help: the trait `Iterator` is implemented for `std::slice::Iter<'a, T>`
  = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `Iterator` for `std::slice::Iter<'_, str>`

error[[E0277]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0277): the size for values of type `str` cannot be known at compilation time
 --> src/lib.rs:4:21
  |
4 |     let a: Vec<_> = b.iter().map(|s| f(s)).collect();
  |                     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `str`
note: required by a bound in `std::slice::Iter`

error[[E0277]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0277): the size for values of type `str` cannot be known at compilation time
 --> src/lib.rs:4:23
  |
4 |     let a: Vec<_> = b.iter().map(|s| f(s)).collect();
  |                       ^^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `str`
note: required by a bound in `core::slice::<impl [T]>::iter`

error[[E0277]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0277): the size for values of type `str` cannot be known at compilation time
 --> src/lib.rs:2:17
  |
2 |     let mut b = vec![];
  |                 ^^^^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `str`
note: required by a bound in `Vec::<T>::new`
  = note: this error originates in the macro `vec` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

error[[E0277]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0277): the size for values of type `str` cannot be known at compilation time
 --> src/lib.rs:2:17
  |
2 |     let mut b = vec![];
  |                 ^^^^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `str`
note: required by a bound in `Vec`
  = note: this error originates in the macro `vec` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

error[[E0599]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0599): the method `collect` exists for struct `Map<std::slice::Iter<'_, str>, [closure@src/lib.rs:4:34: 4:37]>`, but its trait bounds were not satisfied
 --> src/lib.rs:4:44
  |
4 |     let a: Vec<_> = b.iter().map(|s| f(s)).collect();
  |                                            ^^^^^^^ method cannot be called on `Map<std::slice::Iter<'_, str>, [closure@src/lib.rs:4:34: 4:37]>` due to unsatisfied trait bounds
  |
  = note: the following trait bounds were not satisfied:
          `str: Sized`
          which is required by `Map<std::slice::Iter<'_, str>, [closure@src/lib.rs:4:34: 4:37]>: Iterator`
          `std::slice::Iter<'_, str>: Iterator`
          which is required by `Map<std::slice::Iter<'_, str>, [closure@src/lib.rs:4:34: 4:37]>: Iterator`
          `Map<std::slice::Iter<'_, str>, [closure@src/lib.rs:4:34: 4:37]>: Iterator`
          which is required by `&mut Map<std::slice::Iter<'_, str>, [closure@src/lib.rs:4:34: 4:37]>: Iterator`

error[[E0599]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0599): the method `push` exists for struct `Vec<str>`, but its trait bounds were not satisfied
 --> src/lib.rs:5:7
  |
5 |     b.push(s);
  |       ^^^^ method cannot be called on `Vec<str>` due to unsatisfied trait bounds
  |
  = note: the following trait bounds were not satisfied:
          `str: Sized`

Some errors have detailed explanations: E0277, E0599.
For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to 7 previous errors
```

but all of these errors can be summarized to a single root cause: `b` is being inferred to `Vec<str>` due to a call to `to_string`.

If I move `b.push(s)` line to before the offending line:

```rs
fn main() {
    let mut b = vec![];
    let s = "XYZ".to_string();
    b.push(s);
    let a: Vec<_> = b.iter().map(|s| f(s)).collect();
}

fn f(s: &str) -> String {
    s.to_string()
}
```

or relax the parameter type of `f` like this:

```rs
fn main() {
    let mut b = vec![];
    let s = "XYZ".to_string();
    let a: Vec<_> = b.iter().map(|s| f(s)).collect();
    b.push(s);
}

fn f(s: &impl std::ops::Deref<Target=str>) -> String {
    s.to_string()
}
```

then `b` is correctly inferred to `Vec<String>` and all the errors are magically gone.

It looks kinda obvious to me that `b`'s types inferred at `f(s)` and `b.push(s)` conflict with each other, and the conflict can then be automatically resolved with Deref coercion. Even an error pointing directly to `b`'s type would be immensely more helpful than the current wall of errors.
